preferred_framework.name: WinUI 3
reasoning: Fluent-native controls keep parity with Avalonia styling goals while enabling WebView2 diff rendering.
Aligns with Microsoft tooling already validated in packaging rehearsals (MSIX + WebView2 installer workflows).
Packaging transcripts already exist for MSIX-style distribution and self-contained .NET publish flows.

offline_support: Ship NOTICE entries covering Windows App SDK, WinUI, and WebView2 redistribution.

fallbacks.name: Tkinter
fallbacks.use_when: Constrained maintenance utilities that only require basic forms and do not embed HTML reports.
tradeoffs: Lacks built-in WebView for HTML report rendering.
UI polish requires significant custom work to reach production bar.
fallbacks.packaging: Prefer portable zip bundles with embedded CPython runtime; include PSF and Tcl/Tk notices.

fallbacks.name: PySimpleGUI (Tk)
fallbacks.use_when: Small admin helpers where rapid layout iteration outweighs long-term maintenance concerns.
tradeoffs: inherits Tkinter rendering limitations for HTML content.
LGPLv3 obligations demand distributing modified source or written offers.
fallbacks.packaging: Mirror Tkinter portable-zip approach and document LGPLv3 source offer in NOTICE bundle.

fallbacks.name: Electron
fallbacks.use_when: Future HTML-heavy shells that require Chromium runtime and deep telemetry overlays.
tradeoffs: Large download footprint (~100 MB) and Node.js toolchain overhead.
Offline-friendly builds require prebundled npm modules and strengthened signing pipeline.
fallbacks.packaging: MSIX or Squirrel installers with hashed offline bundle; enumerate npm licences in NOTICE.
